DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Extension Disease or Disorder Extent Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Part of the 10-digit EOD [779]. Detailed site-specific codes for anatomic EOD used by SEER for tumors diagnosed from January 1, 1988, through December 31, 2003.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Extension Disease or Disorder Extent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Anatomic extent of disease (EOD) used by SEER for tumors diagnosed from 1988 forward.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredDefinition: Extension; an addition to the length of something.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: To increase in length or duration.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Extension Disease or Disorder Extent Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Extension; an addition to the length of something._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: EOD--Extension Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Codes were revised effective January 1, 1998, to reflect changes in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, Fifth Edition.
